Key Match Events: OG Anunoby has improved his offensive game, averaging 21 points while shooting 53% from the field over the last two games.
Fred VanVleet scored 19 points while shooting 61%, including a three-pointer from 33 feet.
Alperen Sengun matched his season high with 25 points and achieved his most efficient game of the year by shooting 73% from the field.
Post-Match Reflections: The New York Knicks face several concerns following a disappointing 109-97 loss on the road against Houston.
The Knicks' defense has struggled at the beginning of the season, currently ranked 19th in the league.
New York does not have a clear offensive hierarchy despite the talent present on the team.
Others: Cameron Payne did not participate in this game as he recovers from a left hamstring strain.
The Knicks have signed Matt Ryan, a 6-foot-7 wing player who shot 45.1% from three-point range last season with the Pelicans.
Rookie Ariel Hukporti has signed a two-year deal with the Knicks and is expected to receive playing time.
